required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Oral Health Perception and Difficulties Encountered by Parents in the Implementation of Oral Hygiene of Children Under 6
clinical_study.official_title: Oral Health Perception and Difficulties Encountered by Parents in the Implementation of Oral Hygiene of Children Under 6, Qualitative Study.-

brief_summary.textblock:
A qualitative analysis was carried out on 15 participants, in 3 different places: the Montpellier health center, a pediatric odontology practice in Nîmes and a dentistry practice in Marseille.
Two methods of analysis were chosen: thematic analysis and word counting.

primary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the image that parents have of oral health and carious disease
primary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the image that parents of oral health and carious disease by individual semi-guided interview

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluation of the motivations and brakes encountered by parents in the implementation of oral hygiene of their child
secondary_outcome.description: Evaluation of the motivations and brakes encountered by parents in the implementation of oral hygiene of their child with early childhood caries (CPE) by individual semi-guided interview

study_pop.textblock: Parents or caregiver of the child, men or women, aged at least 18 years old, with a good understanding of the French language, accepting the terms of the study and not opposing its realization. The parent or caregiver with at least one child under the age of 6 who has a carious lesion or not.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
Parent or caregiver with at least one child under 6 years of age, with Caod ≥ 1 and high RCI
Exclusion criteria:
- Patient refusing to participate in the study.
- Patient who does not understand the French language or who has difficulty expressing himself.

clinical_study.keyword: Having one child who as less than 6 years old
